net.sourceforge.taglets.simple.filter
Class LiteralTextFilter

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.taglets.simple.filter.AbstractTextFilter
      net.sourceforge.taglets.simple.filter.LiteralTextFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
TextFilter
Direct Known Subclasses:
PreformattedTextFilter
public class LiteralTextFilter
extends AbstractTextFilter

Text filter that is used for literal text output.

Acts as an identity text filter unless configured to format in literal mode. When in literal mode all HTML characters are escaped.

Version:
1.5 (2008/03/30 12:43:18)
Maintainer:
Bruno Essmann <essmann@sourceforge.net>
Since:
1.9.1

LITERAL_KEY

public static final String LITERAL_KEY

Since:

US_ASCII

protected static final int US_ASCII
Encoding bound for 7-bit US-ASCII.

US-ASCII is a 7-bit encoding scheme that covers the English-language alphabet. It is not large enough to cover the characters used in other languages, however, so it is not very useful for internationalization.

Constant Field Value:
127
Since:
1.9.1

Method Detail

encode

protected String encode(String input)
Encodes the specified input string and writes the result to the string buffer specified.

Note:

Uses US_ASCII as encoding boundary. All characters greater than the encoding boundary are encoded as hex characters (format &#xAA;).

Parameters:
input - the input string to encode.
Since:
1.9.1

setLiteral

public void setLiteral(boolean literal)
Sets the literal mode of this text filter.

Parameters:
literal - the new literal mode.
Since:
1.9.1
2.0.0, public to make the LiteralTextFilter more usable.
